Module contents¶

class S2MSI.GranuleInfo(version='lite')[source]¶

Bases: dict

Dict like object with basic information’s about Sentinel2-MSI granules.

Parameters:version (string with granule name, see keys() method for available names) – should be either “lite” or “full”
Returns:dict like object, keys are S2 ganule names (e.g. ‘32UVX’), data can be accessed via () and [] methods

:Example

>>> from S2MSI import GranuleInfo as GranuleInfo
>>> S2gi = GranuleInfo(version="full")
>>> S2gi["32UPV"]
    {u'country': [u'Germany'],
     u'epsg': 32632,
     u'name': u'32UPV',
     u'pos': {u'll': {u'lat': 48.6570271781,
       u'lon': 10.3579107698,
       u'x': 599999.9999970878,
       u'y': 5390220.000326163},
      u'lr': {u'lat': 48.6298215752,
       u'lon': 11.8474784519,
       u'x': 709800.0000132157,
       u'y': 5390220.000321694},
      u'tl': {u'lat': 49.644436702,
       u'lon': 10.3851737332,
       u'x': 600000.0000025682,
       u'y': 5500020.000361709},
      u'tr': {u'lat': 49.6162737214,
       u'lon': 11.9045727629,
       u'x': 709800.0000165974,
       u'y': 5500020.000351718}},
     u'region': [u'Europe'],
     u'zone': 32}
class S2MSI.Image(S2_MSI_granule_path, import_bands='all', namespace='https://psd-12.sentinel2.eo.esa.int/PSD/S2_PDI_Level-1C_Tile_Metadata.xsd', target_resolution=20.0, numpy_type=<class 'numpy.float16'>, unit='reflectance', interpolation_order=1, data_mode='dense', driver='OpenJpeg2000', call_cmd=None, aux_fields=None, logger=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

Reads Sentinel-2 MSI data into numpy array. Images for different channels are resampled to a common sampling :param S2_MSI_granule_path: path to granule folder, folder should contain IMG_DATA folder and S2A_[..].xml file :param import_bands: list of bands to import, default: [‘B01’, ‘B02’, ‘B03’, ‘B04’, ‘B05’, ‘B06’, ‘B07’, ‘B08’,

‘B8A’, ‘B09’, ‘B10’, ‘B11’, ‘B12’,]
Parameters:
  • namespace – for XML file
  • target_resolution – spatial resolution in meter, or “none” for data not interpolated
  • numpy_type – type for result
  • interpolation_order – integer for interpolation 1,2,3
  • data_mode – either “dense” or “sparse”
  • aux_fields – either None or list auf to be loaded aus fields, e.g. [“cwv”,”spr”,”ozo”]
  • driver – should be “OpenJpeg2000” -> glymur, “kdu_expand”->shell command, “gdal_[driver] e.g. gdal_JP2ECW gdal_JPEG2000, gdal_JP2OpenJPEG
S2_image_to_rgb(rgb_bands=('B11', 'B08', 'B03'), rgb_gamma=(1.0, 1.0, 1.0), pixel_dd_hist=20, pixel_dd=1, hist_chop_off=0.01)[source]¶
static find_in_xml(xml, *branch)[source]¶

S2 xml helper function :param xml: xml object :param branch: iterate to branches using find :return: xml object, None if nothing was found

static find_in_xml_root(namespace, xml_root, branch, *branches, findall=None)[source]¶

S2 xml helper function, search from root :param namespace: :param xml_root: :param branch: first branch, is combined with namespace :param branches: repeated find’s along these parameters :param findall: if given, at final a findall :return: found xml object, None if nothing was found

static gdal_read(fnjp, driver_name)[source]¶
static get_values_from_xml(leaf, dtype=<class 'float'>)[source]¶

S2 xml helper function :param leaf: xml object which is searched for VALUES tag which are then composed into a numpy array :param dtype: dtype of returned numpy array :return: numpy array

static parse_S2_granule_xml(fn, namespace)[source]¶

parse XML file in gernule folder and return metadata :param fn: full filename ti xml file :param namespace: xml namespace :return: dictionary with metadata

static parse_S2_product_xml(fn)[source]¶

S2 XML helper function to parse product xml file :param fn: file name of xml file :return: metadata dictionary

static read_aux_data(fn)[source]¶

Read grib file with aux data, return dictionary :param fn: path to granule :return: dict with data

static save_rgb_image(rgb_img, fn, dpi=100.0)[source]¶
class S2MSI.GranuleDEM(fn, driver='glymur')[source]¶

Bases: object

get digital elevation models for S2 MSI Granules from archive

Parameters:
  • fn (string) – filename of DEM archive
  • driver (string) – name of the method to read from the archive, currently “glymur” is implemented
Returns:

Dict like object which returns DEM for given granules if get_dem, [],or () are called
get_dem(tile)[source]¶

Read DEM tile from the archive

Parameters:tile – tilename, e.g. “32UPC”
Returns:numpy array with DEM data
